children.name: need
children.definition: /niːd/  if you need something, you must have it, because you cannot live, succeed, or do something without it:cần
examples: ▪ It’s cold outside -- you’ll need a coat.
▪ I think she might need a doctor.
▪ Do you need some help?
need something for something
cần cái gì đó cho cái gì đó
▪ He needs the information for an article he’s writing.
need to do something
cần để làm cái gì đó
when it is necessary for someone to do something
▪ We need to take the cat to the vet.
need somebody to do something
cần ai đó để làm cái gì đó
▪ Do you still need volunteers to help clean up after the party?
badly need something
rất cần cái gì đó
need something very much
▪ The team badly needs a victory.

children.name: need
children.definition: /niːd/  to need to be cleaned, repaired, or given attention in some way: cần
examples: need cleaning/washing/mending etc
▪ My hair needs washing.
▪ Don’t forget, the plants need watering once a week.
need a wash/clean etc
▪ You don’t have to paint UPVC windows, and they need only an occasional wash down with detergent.

children.name: require
children.definition: /rɪˈkwaɪəʳ/  formal to need something:yêu cầu
examples: ▪ Guests who require special diets should inform the catering manager in advance.
▪ Is there anything further you require, sir?

children.name: could do with/could use
children.definition: /kʊd ˈduː wɪð, kʊd ˈjuːz/  spoken informal say that you could do with something or could use something when you feel that you need it and that it would improve things for you:cần
examples: ▪ ‘Let’s stop for a minute.’ ‘Sure, I could do with a rest.’
▪ I could use a hand with this if you have a minute.
▪ Boy, I sure could use a drink.

children.name: be in need of
children.definition: /biː ɪn ˈniːd ɒv/  if someone is in need of help, advice, money etc, they need it because they are in a difficult situation:cần
examples: ▪ Several people were in need of medical treatment.
badly in need of something
rất cần cái gì đó
▪ The country is badly in need of foreign investment.

children.name: there is a need for
children.definition: /ðeər ɪz ə ˈniːd fɔːʳ/  if there is a need for something, it is needed by a group of people because it is useful or necessary in order to make a situation better:cần
examples: ▪ There’s always a need for blood donors.
▪ There’s no need for you to know my full name. Reggie will do.
there is an urgent need for something
nhu cầu cấp bách về cái gì đó
▪ There is an urgent need for a review of current immigration law.
there is a growing need for something
nhu cầu gia tăng về cái gì đó
▪ There’s a growing need for computer programmers and IT people in many parts of Latin America.

children.name: to need sb or sth very much
be desperate for
children.definition: /biː ˈdespərt fɔːʳ/  to urgently need something and want it very much:rất cần đối với
examples: ▪ Wendell was desperate for a girlfriend, yet crippled by his fear of rejection.
▪ A cordon of police struggled to keep back onlookers and relatives desperate for news.

children.name: be crying out for
children.definition: /biː ˌkraɪ-ɪŋ ˈaʊt fɔːʳ/  if a group of people are crying out for something such as help, food, or medicine, they need it very urgently because they are facing great difficulties without it:rất cần
examples: ▪ The country is crying out for strong leadership.
▪ As we all know, Birmingham has been crying out for a venue for local bands for several years.

children.name: can’t do without
children.definition: /ˌkɑːnt duː wɪðˈaʊtǁˌkænt-/  to be unable to do the things that you have to do without someone who usually helps you or without something that you usually use:rất cần
examples: ▪ I absolutely can’t do without my mobile phone.
▪ Patrick is an excellent assistant - I couldn’t do without him.

children.name: depend on/rely on
children.definition: /dɪˈpend ɒn, rɪˈlaɪ ɒn/  if you depend on or rely on someone or something, you need them because they provide you with something that you need:rất cần, phụ thuộc vào, dựa vào
examples: depend/rely on somebody/something
rất cần,phụ thuộc vào, dựa vào ai đó/cái gì đó
▪ He was growing to depend on her, he knew that.
▪ Not surprisingly, businesses that rely on government contracts are being hit badly by the spending cuts.
depend/rely on somebody to do something
rất cần,phụ thuộc vào, dựa vào ai đó để làm cái gì đó
▪ Elvin depended on her to dress him, feed him and do many other tasks.
▪ Many plants rely on birds to distribute their seeds.
depend/rely on somebody for something
rất cần,phụ thuộc vào, dựa vào ai đó cho cái gì đó
▪ Having to depend on her father for financial support was just not worth it, Sylvia decided.
depend/rely heavily on/upon
quá phụ thuộc vào
depend/rely a lot on
▪ State and local governments rely heavily on sales and property taxes.
dependence[uncountable noun]sự phụ thuộc
▪ Clearly, the US must reduce its dependence on foreign oil.
▪ He is undergoing treatment for drug dependence.

children.name: be dependent on/be reliant on
children.definition: /biː dɪˈpendənt ɒn, biː rɪˈlaɪənt ɒn/  if you are dependent on or are reliant on someone or something, you need them so much that you cannot exist or continue successfully without them, because they provide you with all the most important things you need:quá phụ thuộc vào
examples: ▪ In those days, he was very dependent on Connie and wouldn’t do anything without first consulting her.
be dependent/reliant on somebody/something for something
quá phụ thuộc vào ai đó/cái gì đó cho cái gì đó
▪ Many old people are dependent on government benefits for their basic survival.
be heavily dependent/reliant on
quá phụ thuộc vào
be very reliant on
▪ Small companies are heavily reliant on the goodwill of the banks in order to keep going.

children.name: indispensable
children.definition: /ˌɪndɪˈspensəbəl/  someone or something that isindispensableis so useful and important that you cannot do something without them:không thể thay thế
examples: ▪ For mountain-climbing a really good sleeping-bag is indispensable.
Đối với leo núi, túi ngủ là thứ không thể thiếu.
▪ She soon became an indispensable member of staff
Cô sớm trở thành thành viên không thể thiếu trong đội ngũ nhân viên
.indispensable to
không thể thay thế với
▪ A knowledge of classical music is indispensable to anyone who wants to apply for this job.
Kiến thức về âm nhạc cổ điển là không thể thiếu cho bất cứ ai muốn đăng ký công việc này.

children.name: can’t do
children.definition: /manage without/ˌkɑːnt duː, ˌmænɪdʒ wɪðˈɑʊtǁˌkænt-/  spoken use this about someone or something that is so useful that it would be very difficult to do something without them:không thể thiếu
examples: ▪ Of course we all have concerns about the environment but you can’t do without a car out here in the countryside with no public transport.
Tất nhiên tất cả chúng ta đều có những quan ngại về môi trường nhưng không thể thiếu xe hơi trên đất nước cũng như các phương tiện giao thông công cộng.
▪ Top TV chef Billy Williams says he couldn’t manage without his food processor: ‘It cuts down preparation time by about half and saves you all those fiddly tasks.’

Đầu bếp hàng đầu truyền hình Billy Williams nói rằng ông không thể thiếu máy chế biến thực phẩm: "Nó cắt giảm thời gian chuẩn bị xuống khoảng một nửa và giúp bạn giảm được tất cả những công việc khó khăn đó."

children.name: necessary
children.definition: /ˈnesɪsəri, ˈnesəsəriǁ-seri/  if something is necessary, you need to have it or do it:cần thiết
examples: ▪ He produced the necessary documents and handed them to her.
necessary for
cần thiết cho
▪ Fats in our diet are necessary for both heat and energy.
if necessary
nếu cần
if it is necessary
▪ If necessary, we will have to employ some outside people to finish the job.
it is necessary (for somebody) to do something
cần (ai đó) để làm cái gì đó
formal
▪ It will be necessary to close the pool while the repairs take place.
▪ The doctor says it may be necessary for me to have an operation.

children.name: essential
children.definition: /ɪˈsenʃəl/  if something is essential, you need it because you cannot be successful, healthy, safe etc without it:cần thiết, thiết yếu
examples: ▪ If you’re going hiking in the mountains, a decent pair of boots is essential.
▪ The tourist industry is now acknowledged as an essential part of the Spanish economy.
essential for
cần thiết cho
▪ Calcium is essential for the development of healthy teeth and bones.
it is essential to do something
cần thiết để làm cái gì đó
▪ It is essential to read any document carefully before you sign it.
it is essential that
điều cần thiết là
▪ It is essential that the oil is checked every 10,000 km.

children.name: vital
children.definition: /ˈvaɪtl/  if something is vital, it is extremely important and you will have serious problems if you do not have it or do it:sống còn, quan trọng
examples: ▪ In this job, the ability to remain calm is vital.
▪ The European Space Agency said that a vital piece of equipment on the craft had stopped functioning.
vital for
quan trọng cho
▪ Regular exercise is vital for your health.
it is vital that
điều quan trọng là
▪ It is vital that you keep accurate tax records.

children.name: indispensable
children.definition: /ˌɪndɪˈspensəbəl/  someone or something that is indispensable is extremely useful and it is almost impossible to do something without them:không thể thiếu
examples: ▪ If you’re planning on going sightseeing around the old city, a guide is indispensable.
indispensable to
không thể thiếu đối với
▪ The book will be indispensable to anyone who wishes to learn more about the British Royal Family.

children.name: be a necessity
children.definition: /biː ə nˈsesti/  if something is a necessity, you must have it for your job or for your life, and it is not something that you only have for pleasure:là điều cần thiết
examples: ▪ For most people, a good guidebook is a necessity when travelling.
▪ If you live in a place like London, a car alarm is an absolute necessity.

children.name: be a must
children.definition: /biː ə ˈmʌst/  informal if you say that something such as a book, film, or type of clothes is a must, you mean that people must read, see, or wear it, because it is very fashionable, enjoyable, interesting etc - used especially in advertisements and magazines:là không thể bỏ qua
examples: ▪ If you’re interested in the early history of aviation, this book is a must.
be a must for somebody
là không thể bỏ qua đối với ai đó
▪ Ankle boots are a must for anyone who wants to keep up with the latest fashions this autumn.

children.name: required
children.definition: also requisite formal /rɪˈkwaɪəʳd, ˈrekwzt/  necessary for a particular purpose, especially according to a law or rule:đòi hỏi
examples: ▪ They failed to submit their plans in the required time limit.
▪ If the proposed piece of legislation fails to get the requisite two-thirds majority in Parliament, it cannot become law.
required for
đòi hỏi đối với
▪ In my opinion, she does not have the qualifications required for the job.
▪ Research and writing have become requisite for career advancement in academia.

children.name: make it necessary to do sth
make it necessary
children.definition: /ˌmeɪk ɪt ˈnessəriǁ-seri/
examples: buộc phải
make it necessary to do something
buộc phải làm cái gì đó
▪ The heavy rain made it necessary to close several roads.
▪ By 1870, larger ships and cargoes made it necessary to create a new port at Avonmouth.
make it necessary for somebody to do something
buộc ai đó phải làm cái gì đó
▪ Recent violence has made it necessary for security forces to take drastic measures.

children.name: necessitate
children.definition: /nɪˈsesəteɪt, nəˈsesəteɪt/  formal to make it necessary for you to do something, especially something that is difficult or that you would prefer not to do:đòi hỏi phải
examples: ▪ Sales have dropped dramatically, necessitating cuts in production and employment.
necessitate doing something
đòi hỏi phải làm cái gì đó
▪ The proposed festival would necessitate closing University Avenue between 14th and 24th Streets Northwest.

children.name: need
children.definition: /niːd/  if there is a need for something, that thing is needed:nhu cầu
examples: need for
nhu cầu đối với
▪ Carlton acknowledged that there was a need for stricter safety regulations at some of the sites.
need to do something
nhu cầu để làm cái gì đó
▪ The need to improve teaching standards is recognized; however, it is not something that is going to happen overnight.
feel the need to do something
cảm thấy cần làm cái gì đó
feel that you need to do something
▪ Don’t you ever feel the need to take a vacation?

children.name: necessity
children.definition: /nɪˈsesəti, nəˈsesəti/  something that you must have for your job or for your life, not something that you only have for pleasure:sự cần thiết
examples: ▪ I would say that TV has become more a necessity than a luxury, wouldn’t you?
the bare necessities
nhu cầu thiết yếu
the most important and necessary things such as clothes and food
▪ For several years, the family was forced to make do with just the bare necessities.

children.name: requirement
children.definition: /rɪˈkwaɪəʳmənt/  the amount or level of something that it is necessary to have, especially one that has been officially decided or is officially advised:nhu cầu
examples: ▪ The average daily food requirement for an adult is between 2000 and 3000 calories.
come up to/meet/satisfy a requirement
Đáp ứng yêu cầu
reach the necessary level or amount
▪ For the second year in a row, the city’s water supply has failed to meet minimum purity requirements.

children.name: when a job or activity needs a particular quality
need
children.definition: /niːd/  British if a job or activity needs a particular quality, you must have that quality in order to do it well:cần, đòi hỏi
examples: ▪ Teaching children to read needs a lot of patience and skill.
▪ It must have needed a great deal of self-discipline for you to lose so much weight in such a short time.
▪ What are the qualities that are needed for the job?

children.name: take
children.partOfSpeech: [transitive verb not in progressive or passive]
children.definition: /teɪk/  if a job or activity takes a particular quality, or a lot of time, money, effort etc, you must have that quality or spend a lot of time etc in order to do it:cần, đòi hỏi
examples: ▪ Don’t get discouraged. Learning a new language takes a lot of effort.
it takes something to do something
cần, đòi hỏi cái gì đó để làm cái gì đó
▪ It took us about five months to sell our house.
▪ It takes strength and stamina to be a long-distance runner.

children.name: require
children.definition: /rɪˈkwaɪəʳ/  formal if a job or activity requires a particular quality, you have to have that quality in order to do it well:yêu cầu
examples: ▪ A lot of patience is required to look after a disabled child.
▪ As any couple will tell you, marriage requires commitment and sacrifice from both partners.

children.name: call for
children.definition: /ˈkɔːl fɔːʳ/  if doing something difficult calls for a particular quality or a particular type of behaviour, you must have that quality or behave in that way in order to succeed in doing it:yêu cầu
examples: ▪ The Times crossword calls for a certain amount of literary knowledge.
▪ Launching a new product is a highly complicated business, and careful planning is called for.

children.name: to provide st that is needed or wanted
meet/satisfy a need
children.definition: /ˌmiːt, ˌsætsfaɪ ə ˈniːd/  if someone or something meets or satisfies a need, they give people what they need or want:đáp ứng, thỏa mãn nhu cầu
examples: ▪ Public transportation here has failed to meet the community’s needs.
meet/satisfy a need of
đáp ứng, thỏa mãn nhu cầu của
▪ It’s extremely difficult for one teacher to meet the needs of 16 students in a class when each is working at a different level.
satisfy a basic human need
thỏa mãn nhu cầu cơ bản con người
▪ Belief in God or a supreme being seems to satisfy some basic human need.

children.name: meet requirements
children.definition: also fulfil requirements British /fulfill requirements American /ˌmiːt rɪˈkwaɪəʳmənts, fʊlˌfɪl rɪˈkwaɪəʳmənts/  if someone or something meets or fulfils the requirements that have been set for them, they reach the standards that are necessary, especially standards that have been officially decided:đạt yêu cầu
examples: ▪ Beginning in April, street vendors will be required to meet a tough new set of requirements.
meet requirements for
đạt yêu cầu/tiêu chuẩn đối với
▪ The group has been notified by school officials that it no longer meets the requirements for a voluntary student organization.

children.name: meet demand
children.definition: /ˌmiːt ðə dɪˈmɑːndǁ-ˈmænd/  to provide enough quantities of a product so that everyone who wants one can have one:đáp ứng nhu cầu
examples: ▪ Record stores are finding it difficult to meet the demand for the group’s latest CD, Greasy Pole.
meet demand for
đáp ứng nhu cầu đối với
▪ Ford announced that it has increased production to meet demand for its new range of sports utility vehicle.

children.name: fill a need
children.definition: /ˌfɪl ə ˈniːd/  if something fills a need, for example a new product or service, it gives people something that they have wanted but which they have not been able to have until now:đáp ứng nhu cầu
examples: fill a need for
đáp ứng nhu cầu
▪ The restaurant fills a need for good healthful food and for a good place to meet.
▪ This handsome book fills a need for a clear children’s guide to the African-American tradition of Kwanzaa.

children.name: when you do not need sth
don’t need
children.definition: /ˌdəʊnt ˈniːd/  to not need something or someone:không cần
examples: ▪ Do you want these text books? I don’t need them any more.
▪ Listen, people with disabilities do not need or want your pity.
▪ According to Mahoney, the company did not need the cash, but was selling the division in an effort to streamline its operations.

children.name: spare
children.definition: /speəʳ/  use this about something which you do not need now, but which is available so that you can use it later or let someone else use it:dư, thừa
examples: ▪ We have two spare tickets for the game - do you want to come?
▪ Some couples will start married life in a spare room at the home of one set of parents -- usually the bride’s.
spare change
tiền lẻ dư
▪ It seemed like every time I turned around, some bum was hitting me up for spare change.

children.name: can do without
children.definition: also can manage without /kən ˌduː wɪðˈaʊt, kən ˌmænɪdʒ wɪðˈaʊt/  to not need someone or something, because you can live normally or do what you need to do without them:không cần
examples: ▪ We should be able to manage without you for a few days.
▪ ‘I can do without alcohol, but I can’t do without the cigs,’ O'Hare wheezed.

children.name: have no use for
children.definition: /ˌhæv nəʊ ˈjuːs fɔː/  to not need someone or something because you no longer use them or cannot think of a way of using them:không cần dùng, không cần đến
examples: ▪ The fish spend their lives in darkness, and, having no use for eyes, are totally blind.
▪ If society has no use for old people, is it any wonder that older people feel that their lives are without meaning?

children.name: have no need of
children.definition: /ˌhæv nəʊ ˈniːd ɒv/  formal to not need something:không cần đến
examples: ▪ Japan has its own space program and has no need of American technology.

children.name: can dispense with
children.definition: /kən dɪˈspens wɪð/  formal to not need to use or do something that you usually use or do, because it is no longer necessary:không cần đến (trang trọng)
examples: ▪ The company decided that it could dispense with the middle management level altogether.
dispense with the formalities
không cần thủ tục rườm rà
to not use formal or very polite behaviour, such as introducing people to each other
▪ We all know each other here, so I think we can dispense with the formalities.
